Class QuizGame

java.lang.Object
logic.QuizGame
public class QuizGame extends Object
Manages the core game logic for Quiz Mania. Handles game state, scoring, round management and question flow. This class coordinates between the UI and database layers.

      public QuizGame(String difficulty, String username, int userId)
      Creates a new QuizGame instance.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The difficulty level for the game
      username - The player's username
      userId - The player's user ID

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentQuestion

      public Question getCurrentQuestion()
      Gets the current question being displayed.
      Returns:
      Current Question object or null if game is over

    • submitAnswer

      public boolean submitAnswer(String selectedOption)
      Submits an answer for the current question.
      Parameters:
      selectedOption - The option selected by player (A, B, C or D)
      Returns:
      true if round is complete, false otherwise

    • isRoundComplete

      public boolean isRoundComplete()
      Check if round is complete
      Returns:
      true if round is complete, false otherwise

    • isGameComplete

      public boolean isGameComplete()
      Check if game is complete
      Returns:
      true if game is complete, false otherwise

    • moveToNextRound

      public void moveToNextRound()
      Moves the game to the next round. Resets round score and increments round counter.

    • isGameSaved

      public boolean isGameSaved()
      Checks if the game has been saved to database.
      Returns:
      true if game is saved, false otherwise

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the game progress and score to database. Called when game ends or user quits.

      public int getCurrentRound()
      Gets the current round number.
      Returns:
      Current round number (1-5)

      public boolean hasEnoughQuestions()
      Checks if there are enough questions to start the game.
      Returns:
      true if minimum questions available, false otherwise

    • printGameState

      public void printGameState()
      Prints game state for debugging purposes. Shows current round, score, and game progress.
